encodingDesc.p: This file encoded to comply with EpiDoc Guidelines and Schema version 8 http://www.stoa.org/epidoc/gl/5/

bibl.title: Herodotus' Ethnography. Examples and Principles.
bibl.note: Uses mainly examples present in Book II. - I. The strange aspect of otherness, its variety and the question of different "stages of civilization". - II. The ambiguity of otherness and its mirror-effect. - III. The ambiguous aspect of cultural "development" by "learning" from other peoples' lifestyle. - IV. Learning from other peoples' culture and the identity of the Greeks.
